segments.text: I don't know, Brian, if they uh--it's been three years.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Hey, you just got to keep on going.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: No, I don't know, I--maybe this isn't for me. You know, maybe this isn't the right business for me.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: No, don't think like that.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I just, I see all these other people getting commercials and work and it's like I'm not getting anything.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I have no money behind me. Nothing. I'm twenty five and--
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Russel Crowe wasn't forty until he got his big stuff.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: If you really want to do it-I mean,
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: So I'll have to wait twenty five years-
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: you got to do.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: -just going and auditioning and auditioning and rejection after refection, it's like--
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You could. You could. We just--
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: we're just pooling our funds together.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I know, I just don't know if I can handle it. I mean, you're helping me so much financially it's like I can't survive on my own without you. I don't like that.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You don't owe me anything.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I feel like I'm not doing anything. Like I'm not giving anything into this world.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You are, you're going to class, you're learning, you're getting better. When you finally get that role you're going to be prepared.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yeah, but what if I never make it? What if I studied all my life, this theatre, this acting, and I'm never going to get anywhere. I'm never going to be able to have a job.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Oh my God, Anna, you're still young. Don't even think about that.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Time is passing by. Every year it's
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: a part left than I can do.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You're only twenty five, okay? Some people don't start until they're thirty five.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Really?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yeah.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I don't know, I just [BREATHING] I get frustrated
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What would you do- What would you do if you didn't? You can go to law school.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: That's the thing. I don't know. I don't know anything.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Law school? Maybe.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I don't know. I don't know anything other than this, though, is the problem. This is my life. This is what I built everything about, you know.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: See? So you can't just quit now.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I mean, I could go to law school, but I'm just not passionate about it, you know? Like I'm not--it doesn't drive me, it doesn't motivate me. I--
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Have you been going to auditions and stuff?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yeah. I mean, I get a call-back and stuff, but-
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I just, I need a break. I need something to break me out.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: How's the job? Still waiting tables at Denny's?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yeah. Unfortunately.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yeah, so I go to--get an education for four years and I'm waiting tables at Denny's.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Well, they tip well.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: [BREATHING] Brian-
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: it's not funny. I just don't know what I'm going to do.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Maybe you could start teaching. I don't know.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yeah, I guess I could.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Go back to school. You know? Another three more years, get your master's.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yeah
segments.speaker: F
